com.yantra.api.ydm

Interface unconfirmShipment

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YDMApi, YIFApi

    public interface unconfirmShipment

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document unconfirmShipment(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The unconfirmShipment is used to unship a shipped shipment and place the shipment into the status that it was in prior to the time that it was shipped.

    • Method Detail

      • unconfirmShipment

        org.w3c.dom.Document unconfirmShipment(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException

        The unconfirmShipment is used to unship a shipped shipment and place the shipment into the status that it was in prior to the time that it was shipped.

        When a shipment is unshipped, the drop status of the shipment will be determined base on the configuration of the UNCONFIRM_SHIPMENT transaction and the base status of the previous status that it was in prior to the time that it was shipped. This will be based on the last status audit of the shipment in the YFS_SHIPMENT_STATUS_AUDIT table. For instance, if a shipment was in the "1100 - Shipment Created" status before it was shipped. It will be dropped back into the "1100 - Shipment Created" status (if it is configured for the Unconfirm Shipment transaction in the pipeline) after it has been unshipped. If the shipment was containerized and was in the "1300 - Shipment Packed" status, it will be dropped back into the "1300 - Shipment Packed" status when it's configured for the Unconfirm Shipment transaction in the pipeline.

        Note: For the shipments, which were create and confirm simultaneously in one confirmShipment call, the drop status will be "1100 - Shipment Created".

        It is assumed that the unconfirmShipment API should only be used for shipments, which have not left the node.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        See Additional Information to get information for more details.

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetTagNoUE
        com.yantra.ydm.japi.ue.YDMCanShipmentBeProcessedUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetOverriddenOveragePercentageUE

        Events Raised:

        Events raised for UNCONFIRM_SHIPMENT transaction

          ON_SUCCESS:
            Data Published - YDM_UNCONFIRM_SHIPMENT.ON_SUCCESS.html
            Key data - shipment_dbd.txt

          Template Support: Yes

        Audits:
        YFS_SHIPMENT_STATUS_AUDIT record is written indicating the from and to status change.

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support:Yes

        Additional Information

        Shipment Updates
        Besides the status of the shipment, the following shipment attributes will be updated once a shipment has been unshipped.

        • The ShipmentConfirmUpdatesDone flag will be set to "N".
        • The ShipDate attribute will be reset back to the requested ship date.
        • The ActualShipmentDate attribute will be reset back to the high date (1/1/2500).

        WMS Updates
        When a shipment is unshipped, the following updates will be performed.

        • LPNs will be recreated base on the containers of the shipment at the shipment sort location. Note: LPNs created would not have any contents. They would be just LPN headers created for tracking the location of the outbound containers. LPN content details will only be available from the Container Details table.
        • Location inventory will be reinstated at the ship node and the shipment sort location base on the information on the shipment lines and containers. For un-containerized lines, location inventory is adjusted.
        • The AtNode field of the GlobalSerialNumber, which corresponds to the YFS_Shipment_Tag_Serial of both shipment lines and containers, will be updated to "Y".

        Order Updates
        When a shipment is unshipped, the following updates will be performed. After unshipping a shipment, the status of the order will be changed base on the configuration of the UNSHIP_SHIPMENT transaction in the order pipeline. If the Unship Shipment transaction is configured to drop into the "3350 - Included In Shipment" status, the quantity that was in "3700 - Shipped" status will be moved to "3350 - Included In Shipment". Furthermore, inventory updates will occur according to the status movement. For instance in the Sales Order Fulfillment scenario, the corresponding supply will be increased and allocated demand will be recreated for the unshipped quantities.
        For WMS nodes only demand updates are done for the unshipped quantities. The supply updates are transmitted via location inventory updates being propagated to supply.

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains all the information about the shipment. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
